shotDuration.notes: One shot = 8 seconds editorial unit. Kling may generate longer clips, but system assumes only first ~8 seconds are usable. Prompts must describe ONE continuous action suitable for 8-second shot.

cameraMovement.philosophy: Smooth cinematic motion only - deliberate and motivated. No shaky cam.

allowed.description: Slow dolly push toward subject to increase intimacy or reveal detail
Slow dolly pull to reveal environment or create emotional distance
Follow subject smoothly, maintaining consistent distance
Horizontal camera rotation to reveal space or follow action
Vertical rise to reveal scale or create god's-eye perspective
Circular movement around subject to show dimensionality
No camera movement - let action play out in frame

available.use: Establishing shots, environmental context, emphasizing space
available.effect: Wide field of view, slight distortion, sense of expansive space

available.use: Balanced storytelling, character in environment, cinematic feel
available.effect: Anamorphic bokeh, moderate depth, cinematic compression, widescreen aesthetic

available.use: Natural perspective, human-eye view, intimate moments
available.effect: Natural field of view, moderate depth of field, realistic spatial relationships
Compressed depth, cinematic bokeh, subject isolation, flattering compression

compositions.use: Dynamic framing for active subjects, visual interest
Symmetrical scenes, emphasis on subject power or isolation
Draw eye toward subject, create depth

shotSizes.description: Eyes, hands, objects - detail and emotion
Full body with some environment - context
Vast environment, tiny figure - scale and isolation

depthOfField.philosophy: Use shallow focus for character intimacy and subject isolation. Use deep focus for environmental context and spatial relationships.

constraints.rule: One action per shot - describe single continuous action suitable for 8-second duration
No scene cuts within shot - each shot is one continuous take
Camera movement must be continuous and describable in one sentence
No ambiguous or conflicting camera directions

notes: Camera language serves story and emotion. Every movement must be motivated. Prefer simplicity and clarity over complexity.
